page.title: 15THE PAST OF N.BRISTOL
page.content: In{Southmead}a{tumulus}indicates early habitation.This planned residential area grew rapidly from 1930's.Until this century it was part of the rural parish of{Henbury}or{Westbury},both medieval churches with Saxon foundations linked in 1093 when{Bishop {Worcester}gave Henbury to the Westbury Benedictines.Later the monastery became a college of canons.A gatehouse survives.Both churches have local memorials.Opulent mansions in the 17'th to 19'th centuries burgeoned: Southmead police house,Henbury Awdlett is a school,{Blaise House},a museum. Westbury Poor House now a house, Henbury Charity School is the village hall.Some inns go back to droving & coaching days. There is a Westbury lock-up & a pack horse bridge,an old lodge at Brentry. Charlton Rd led to {Charlton Village}destroyed in 1946.
